meanings.definition: To walk or move heavily and clumsily.
meanings.sent1: The tired bear was schlumping through the forest after a long day of fishing.
meanings.sent2: I saw the old man schlumping along the sidewalk with his cane.
meanings.sent3: The penguin was schlumping around the zoo, amusing the visitors with its waddling walk.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were schlumping across the sky, casting shadows on the fields below.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was schlumping around the playground, trying to keep up with the older kids.

meanings.definition: To sit or slump in a relaxed or lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: After a big meal, I enjoy schlumping on the couch and watching TV.
meanings.sent2: The cat was schlumping in the sunbeam, purring contentedly.
meanings.sent3: I found my dog schlumping on my bed, looking guilty after stealing my socks.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were schlumping in the vase, their petals drooping from lack of water.
meanings.sent5: The students were schlumping in their chairs, bored with the lecture.
